Source code for havoc.autoval.tests.oem_command_check.oem_command_check

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals

import os
import copy
import random
import re

from havoc.autoval.lib.test_base import TestBase
from havoc.autoval.lib.host.host import Host
from havoc.lib.havoc_exceptions import HavocTestException
"""
This Test is to check the OEM cmos boot order reset
"""



[docs]class OemCommandCheck(TestBase):

[docs]    def __init__(self):
        super(OemCommandCheck, self).__init__()
        self.mode = self.test_control.get('method', False)
        self.bios_changed = 0



[docs]    def execute(self):
        self.log_info("This is a Oem Command Check Test")

        self.original_bios_path = os.path.join(
            self.system_log_dir, "bios_settings_start.dump"
        )
        if "oob" in self.mode:
            self.oob_boot_order()
        else:
            self.inband_boot_order()



[docs]    def oob_boot_order(self):
        reset_options = self.host.oob.get_bios_reset_options()
        for util in reset_options.keys():
            self.log_info("Get the default boot order using %s method" % util)
            reset_options[util]()
            current_seq = self.host.oob.get_current_boot_order()

            self.log_info("Current boot sequence is %s" % current_seq)
            self.log_info("Change the current boot sequence")
            random_seq = self.host.oob.get_random_boot_order()
            random_seq = self.host.oob.shuffle_boot_order(random_seq)
            self.host.oob.set_current_boot_order(random_seq)
            new_expected_seq = self.host.oob.get_current_boot_order()
            self.log_info(
                "changing boot sequence to %s " % new_expected_seq
            )
            self.host.oob.cycle()

            self.log_info("Verify boot order after power cycle")
            verify_expected_seq = self.host.oob.get_current_boot_order()
            self.log_info(
                "boot sequence after cycle %s " % verify_expected_seq
            )
            self.validate_equal(new_expected_seq, verify_expected_seq,
                "Check if both have the same boot order")


            self.log_info("set the default boot order using %s method" % util)
            reset_options[util]()
            default_expected_seq = self.host.oob.get_current_boot_order()
            self.log_info(
                "Verify default boot sequence  %s " % default_expected_seq
            )
            self.validate_equal(current_seq, default_expected_seq,
                "Check default boot order are same")



[docs]    def inband_boot_order(self):
        reset_options = self.host.oob.get_bios_reset_options()

        for util in reset_options.keys():
            self.log_info("set the default boot order using %s method" % util)
            reset_options[util]()

            self.log_info("Pulling current boot sequence")
            self.bios_settings_default_sequence = os.path.join(
                self.system_log_dir, "bios_settings_default_sequence.dump"
            )
            self.bios_settings_default_sequence = self.host.bios.get_bios_settings_dump(
                self.bios_settings_default_sequence
            )
            current_seq = self.host.bios.get_current_boot_sequence(
                self.bios_settings_default_sequence
            )

            self.log_info("Current boot sequence is %s" % current_seq)
            new_expected_seq = self.shuffle_boot_seq(current_seq)

            self.bios_settings = self.build_bios_settings_using_boot_sequence(
                new_expected_seq, cmos_reset=False
            )
            self.log_info(
                "changing boot sequence to %s and validate" % new_expected_seq
            )
            bios_settings_changed = os.path.join(
                self.system_log_dir, "bios_settings_changed.dump"
            )
            self.bios_changed = self.host.bios.update_bios_settings(
                self.bios_settings, bios_settings_changed
            )
            self.log_info("validate new boot sequence settings")

            self.bios_settings_applied = os.path.join(
                self.system_log_dir, "bios_settings_applied.dump"
            )
            self.bios_settings_applied = self.host.bios.get_bios_settings_dump(
                self.bios_settings_applied
            )
            self.bios_settings_applied_parsed = self.host.bios.parse_bios_dump_file(
                self.bios_settings_applied
            )
            self.validate_no_exception(
                self.host.bios.check_bios_settings,
                [self.bios_settings_applied_parsed, self.bios_settings],
                "Verify bios settings after reboot",
            )
            self.log_info("clearing boot sequence using %s option" % util)
            reset_options[util]()
            self.after_clear_bios_path = os.path.join(
                self.system_log_dir, "bios_settings_reset.dump"
            )
            self.log_info("get new bios settings")
            self.after_clear_bios_path = self.host.bios.get_bios_settings_dump(
                self.after_clear_bios_path
            )
            self.after_clear_bios_parsed = self.host.bios.parse_bios_dump_file(
                self.after_clear_bios_path
            )
            self.bios_settings = self.build_bios_settings_using_boot_sequence(
                current_seq, cmos_reset=True
            )
            self.validate_no_exception(
                self.host.bios.check_bios_settings,
                [self.after_clear_bios_parsed, self.bios_settings],
                "validating the boot sequence after cmos clearance. "
                "Comparing {} with {}".format(
                    self.bios_settings_default_sequence, self.after_clear_bios_path
                ),
            )



[docs]    def shuffle_boot_seq(self, current_seq):
        new_expected_seq = copy.copy(current_seq)
        disabled_options = []
        low_pri_options = []
        enabled_options = []
        for i, item in enumerate(new_expected_seq):
            if re.search("Disabled|Built-in EFI Shell", item):
                disabled_options.append(new_expected_seq[i])
            elif re.search("HDD|CentOS", item):
                low_pri_options.append(new_expected_seq[i])
            else:
                enabled_options.append(new_expected_seq[i])
        if len(enabled_options) < 2:
            raise HavocTestException("Not enough boot options to shuffle order")
        while new_expected_seq == current_seq:
            random.shuffle(enabled_options)
            # Move 'HDD' and 'Built-in EFI Shell' to the last enabled position
            # so we don't accidentally boot from it if we don't want to
            # and always have the disabled option to be at the end of
            new_expected_seq = enabled_options + low_pri_options + disabled_options

        return new_expected_seq



[docs]    def build_bios_settings_using_boot_sequence(
        self, boot_sequence, cmos_reset=True
    ):
        make = self.host.oob.get_manufacturer().lower()
        if make == "wiwynn":
            """
            The Boot Sequence setting token for wiwynn system is B3
            see the setting below
            ----------------------------------------
                Setup Question  = Boot Option #
                Token   =B3 // Do NOT change this line
                Offset  =00
                Width   =02
                ListOrder   =[0000] CentOS
                         [0005] CentOS
                         [0003] UEFI: PXE IPv4 Broadcom BCM57302 NetXtreme-C
                         [0004] UEFI: PXE IPv6 Broadcom BCM57302 NetXtreme-C
                         [0001] UEFI: Built-in EFI Shell
            ----------------------------------------
            """
            my_bios_settings = {
                "Boot Option #": {
                    "token": self.host.bios.get_boot_option_seq_token_number(),
                    "ListOrder": boot_sequence,
                }
            }
            my_bios_settings.update(
                self.host.bios.boot_sequence_additional_settings(cmos_reset)
            )
        else:
            my_bios_settings = {
                "Boot Option #1": {"token": "1080", "Options": boot_sequence[0]},
                "Boot Option #2": {"token": "1081", "Options": boot_sequence[1]},
                "Boot Option #3": {"token": "1082", "Options": boot_sequence[2]},
                "Boot Option #4": {"token": "1083", "Options": boot_sequence[3]},
            }
        return my_bios_settings



[docs]    def cleanup(self):
        if self.host is not None:
            if not self.mode:
                self.log_info("Reverting back the original BIOS settings")
                self.host.bios.update_bios_setting_from_dump(self.original_bios_path)
        super(OemCommandCheck, self).cleanup(
            cfg_filter=["log_util", "bios_settings"], config_check=True,
            config_data=None
        )




[docs]def main():
    test = OemCommandCheck()
    test.lifecycle()



if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
